events.name: BANCOR Keynote : Igniting the long tail of cryptocurrencies
events.description: The project: On June 12 the Bancor protocol broke crowdsale records, raising $153 million in 2.5 hours. The goal: to create a new form of currency called ‘smart tokens’, and use them to bring total liquidity to all cryptocurrencies & ignite a long tail of cryptocurrencies for every use case we humans can come up with. Visit https://www.bancor.network/ for more information  About the speaker: Eddy has been a blockchain geek since being introduced to Bitcoin a few months before it broke $1000 in 2013. Since then he’s helped start the Bitcoins in Bali group, re-start the Bitcoin Singapore meetup, and growth hacked for companies like TenX, Golem, and now Bancor. Timeline of Event: 18:30 - 19:00 : Registration 19:00 - 20:00 : Keynote 20:00-20:30 : Networking 20:30 onwards : Closing Off Organizers:    Venue sponsors:  See you there!

events.name: WWCode Data Mining Seminar
events.description: Data is big now, so big we call it Big Data! =PCome join us to find out how to find out what data can do in this information age using Data Mining.Our network Director Yue Lin CHOONG will take us through the process of Data Mining, followed by a Rattle walk through. If you would like to follow along with the Rattle walk through, please install R & RStudio before hand.And install the rattle package on R. Agenda:6:30pm Registration and Food7:00pm Introductions7:10pm Data Mining Talk7:50pm Break8:00pm Rattle Walkthrough8:30pm Wrap up This session assumes knowledge of computer science. This workshop is intended for ladies, and is open to everyone who is there to inspire women to excel in tech careers
events.location: Rakuten Crimson House, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: October Monthly Meet - Rise of the Bots & Attacks on SMB Honeypots
events.description:
Agenda • Food, Drinks & Networking (20 mins) • Introduction & Announcement (10 mins) • Rise of the Bots by Dawson Sewo (45 mins) • Break (5 mins)  • Tons of WannaCry & Evils Attacked my SMB Honeypot! by Tan Kean Siong (45 mins) 


Abstracts Internet Bots by Dawson Sewo The rise of sophisticated malicious bots, such as ones designed for credential abuse, require new intelligent management techniques.  In this session, we will look at how bots have evolved along the way and the different ways bots are impacting business. Have a deeper understanding in terms of how credential abuse that leads to fraud is carried out. Learn how to identify bots and tips for managing them via advance technique such a neuro-muscular interaction. There will also be a demo to showcase how advance bot detection works. Tons of WannaCry & Evils Attacked my SMB Honeypot! by Tan Kean Siong In May 2017, WannaCry, Eternal Blue, Double Pulsar are the most trending topics on the planet. During the outbreak, we designed a ‘real’ Windows 7 with the open source Dionaea honeypot, and exposed the favourable SMB port to the Internet. It is interesting to observe tons of WannaCry ransomware attacked the pot. Surprisingly, there are more juicy collection than that! RAT, Bitcoin Miner, Trojan, Eternal Rocks, reverse shell, etc are fighting each others to pwn the pot. In this session, we will share the collected data and interesting stories, from a single home-based honeypot. 


Speakers' Bio Dawson Sewo is a Senior Enterprise Security Architect for Akamai's Asia-Pacific Region. He is responsible for defining solutions and architectural designs to protect customers' network, websites and applications from DDoS, web application attacks and malicious bot.  Dawson is an evangelist for better security practices and operations. He has extensive experience in delivering security solutions especially for BFSI and government agencies across Southeast Asia and North Asia. Tan Kean Siong is an active member of The Honeynet Project - an open source community dedicated to study latest cyber attacks and deception technology. He enjoys reading the backlog of various honeypot sensors over the net, analysing and hunting for evil. He's involved in open source network honeypot development e.g. Dionaea, Honeeepi and Glutton, and presented in various conferences.
events.location: Akamai Technologies, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Level 16, Singapore 048616

events.name: PR for Startups: How to Generate Buzz
events.description:
Want to generate press for your startup but have no budget? Join us for this PR 101 session for startup founders, marketers and general enthusiasts who would like to learn effective strategies and tips.

Tech and start-up public relations veteran Susie Hughes will host 'PR 101,' a session for early to mid-stage companies that will cover tips and tricks for driving PR and communications results through effective storytelling, media relations and content development. Susie is a vice president with Allison+Partners, a global marketing communications agency that has managed successful communications programs around the world for the likes of Dropbox, Viber, Airbnb, Carousell and many more.

Agenda: 
6:30 - 7:00 PM: Registration 
7:00 - 7:45 PM: Talk by Susie Hughes, VP, Allison+Partners 
7:45 - 9:00 PM: Q&A/ Networking
events.location: General Assembly, Level 3, 8 Claymore Hill, Spacemob, Singapore 229572

events.name: Twelfth IEEE International Workshop - Day 4
events.description: This workshop aims at bringing together researchers from both academia and industry to showcase their work and obtain feedback. It serves as a forum for the sensing network research communities working on embedded sensing systems to discuss open issues, novel solutions, and the future development of wireless sensing in general. We encourage contributions describing innovative work in the realms of wireless sensor networks, cyber-physical systems, smart spaces, and all related disciplines. Partner Event : https://www.senseapp.org/de/senseapp/ieee-senseapp-2017/?no_cache=1 Agenda : http://www.ieeelcn.org/Program_technical.html You must register to attend : https://www.senseapp.org/de/senseapp/registration/ DataTorrent RTS is being actively used in big data & cloud use cases relating to Financial services (Fraud, CyberSecurity), AdTech, IOT, Energy & Utilities, Healthcare, Telco, Retail & E_Commerce etc. To reduce time to market and total cost of ownership, look at operable app factory. You can quickly import and launch micro data services from this factory. Examples: HDFS to HDFS & HDFS-Line-Copy (back-up, replication, disaster-recovery, distcp replacement, continuous big data sync); Kafka  to HDFS (ingest, transform); S3 to HDFS (cloud to on-prem, continuous big data cloud sync); HDFS to Kafka (data lake to event stream, big data log streaming); Database to HDFS (db offload); Database to Database (change data capture, customer 360); Kafka to Database (ingest, transform & load); Kinesis to S3 (Cloud ingest, transform, & load), Data Preparation/Quality, Scale out CEP, Scale out OLAP, Store and replay, Machine scoring, etc. All micro data services include real-time dashboarding of real-time as well as historical metrics. events.name: Cloud & Cyber Security Expo - Day 2
events.description: Cloud & Cyber Security Expo, Singapore 2017 is where you will find these solutions – efficient, money-saving, hassle-free and smart cyber security solutions to ensure your businesses are locked down tight and most importantly, allow you to fearlessly employ the latest breakthroughs and business-winning technology. Not just for the security professional, Cloud & Cyber Security Expo is also a must-attend for any IT decision maker, offering all the answers thanks to its co-location with Asia’s largest and multi-awarding winning Cloud Expo Asia,  Data Centre World, Big Data World and Smart IoT Singapore. With your free ticket, you can come and learn from the global business experts like Sophos, CarbonBlack, Barracuda, Gigamon, CenturyLink, Thales and Imperva through to leaders of innovative Asian and international start-ups. Plus, hear from peers from your own industry, discussing best-of-breed cloud and cyber security technologies and how they have used them to secure their business. Your free ticket admits you into Cloud & Cyber Security Expo, Cloud Expo Asia, Smart IoT Singapore, Data Centre World and new launch for 2017 Big Data World! events.name: Cloud Expo Asia - Day 2
events.description: When you attend Cloud Expo Asia, you leave impossible at the door. To walk into Marina Bay Sands Expo and Convention Centre on the 11th and 12th October 2017 is to enter a world of the infinitely possible. Whether you represent a small start-up or a vast corporation, the Cloud is now a reality in the way we all do business every day. We’re way past if. We’re way beyond when? We’re now at how. And the how is all here in one industry-leading event over two packed days and in the presence of the leading minds and the best suppliers. And as Cloud 2.0 takes effect and increasing numbers of organisations migrate towards cloud technology, it’s a bewildering world. Cloud Expo Asia 2017 will make that world clear.
